content.question: His lacrimis vitam damus et miserescimus ultro. Ipse viro primus manicas atque arta levari vincla iubet Priamus dictisque ita fatur amicis: "Quisquis es, amissos hinc iam obliviscere Graios 5(noster eris) mihique haec edissere vera roganti: Quo molem hanc immanis equi statuere? Quis auctor? Quidve petunt? Quae religio? Aut quae machina belli?" Aeneid 2. 145-151 Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question. 1. In lines 1-3 (His . . . amicis), which three Latin words can be translated “that the man’s chains be removed”? 2. (A) Identify one and only one literary device in lines 2-3 (Ipse . . . amicis) and (B) write out the Latin word or words that illustrate it. 3. (A) Identify two participles in this passage and (B) translate in context each participle together with the noun or pronoun that it modifies. 4. In lines 4-7 (Quisquis . . . belli), which two Latin words indicate that Priam welcomes the stranger among the Trojans? 5. Who or what is the implied subject of statuere (line 6) ? 6. (A) What are the case and number of equi (line 6) and (B) on which Latin word does it depend? 7. Briefly describe what, according to earlier in Book 2, the Greek fleet actually did (rather than sail home) in order to conquer Troy. Answer in 1-2 complete sentences.
